Gpt.1: GPT demonstrated strong understanding of the core concepts in HW1 but struggled with the optional edge-case implementation.
Gpt.2: Excellent performance on theoretical questions. The code provided was Pythonic and well-commented.

Claude.1: Claude provided very verbose explanations. While accurate, the length made it difficult to find the specific answer key.
Claude.2: Struggled with the mathematical proofs in Question 3, but the programming section was flawless.

Gemini.1: Provided the most concise solution. However, it hallucinated a library function that does not exist in the standard library.
Gemini.2: Solid performance across the board. The reasoning for the algorithm selection was particularly insightful.
